name: Format\EmbedWebVideo
description: The component for adding a web video from Dailymotion, Vimeo, or YouTube.

properties.name: role
properties.description: Always embedwebvideo or embedvideo for this component.

properties.name: URL
properties.description:
The URL of the embeddable video to display (the Dailymotion, Vimeo, or YouTube embed link). The embed URL is usually different from the standard video URL.
A Dailymotion embed URL typically looks like this: https://geo.dailymotion.com/player.html?video=x84sh87
A Vimeo embed URL typically looks like this: https://player.vimeo.com/video/121450839
A YouTube embed URL typically looks like this: https://www.youtube.com/embed/0qwALOOvUik

properties.name: accessibilityCaption
properties.description: A caption that describes the content of the embedded web video. The text is used for VoiceOver. For more information about VoiceOver, see the  page in Accessibility. If accessibilityCaption is not provided, the caption value is used for VoiceOver for iOS, VoiceOver for iPadOS, and VoiceOver for macOS.

properties.name: anchor
properties.description: An object that defines vertical alignment with another component.

properties.name: animation
properties.description:
An object that defines an animation to be applied to the component.
The none value is used for conditional design elements. Adding it here has no effect.

properties.name: aspectRatio
properties.description:
The aspect ratio of the video: width divided by height. The aspect ratio determines the height of the video player.
When this property is omitted, the video player will have a 16:9 aspect ratio (1.777), and videos with ratios other than 16:9 will automatically be letterboxed.

properties.name: behavior
properties.description:
An object that defines behavior for a component, like  or .
The none value is used for conditional design elements. Adding it here has no effect.

properties.name: caption
properties.description: A caption that describes the content of the embedded web video. This text is used by VoiceOver if accessibilityCaption is not provided, or it can be shown when the embedded web video cannot be played.  For more information about VoiceOver, see the  page in Accessibility.

properties.name: conditional
properties.description: An instance or array of component properties that can be applied conditionally, and the conditions that cause them to be applied.

properties.name: explicitContent
properties.description: A Boolean value that indicates that the embedded web video may contain explicit content.

properties.name: hidden
properties.description: A Boolean value that determines whether the component is hidden.

properties.name: identifier
properties.description: An optional unique identifier for this component. If used, this identifier must be unique across the entire document. You will need an identifier for your component if you want to anchor other components to it. See .

properties.name: layout
properties.description:
An inline ComponentLayout object that contains layout information, or a string reference to a ComponentLayout object that is defined at the top level of the document. 
If layout is not defined, size and position are based on various factors, such as the device type, the length of the content, and the role of this component.

properties.name: style
properties.description:
An inline ComponentStyle object that defines the appearance of this component, or a string reference to a ComponentStyle object that is defined at the top level of the document.
The none value is used for conditional design elements. Adding it here has no effect.
